data.title: Node.js Debug: don't pass additional `--inspect=5858` arg if one's explicitly set in config
data.body:
- VS Code Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64
- Debugger for Chrome version: 3.1.2

Consider the following `launch.json`:
```javascript
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "nodemon",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "runtimeExecutable": "nodemon",
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "--inspect=5858"
             // "--inspect-brk=5858"
            ],
            "protocol": "inspector"
        }
    ]
}
```

Launching this configuration results in the following command execution:
`nodemon --inspect=15887 --debug-brk --inspect=5858`

Don't pass default `--inspect` argument if there's already one `--inspect=5858` or `--inspect-brk=5858` set explicitly. And honor the value of the explicitly passed argument instead.

The same story for `"protocol": "legacy"`, and `--debug=5858` or `--debug-brk=5858` set explicitly, cause it results in:
`nodemon --debug-brk=27078 --debug-brk=5858`

data.title: Consider `afterLaunchTask` debug configuration option
data.body:
- VS Code Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

We have `preLaunchTask` debug configuration option. So far so good. It would be great to have `afterLaunchTask` option also.

Consider a case: `preLaunchTask` starts and make project build, then debugging session starts and `afterLaunchTask` starts and watch for source code changes.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|theme-monokai-light|anoff|1.0.3|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.4.2|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0|
|ejs-language-support|QassimFarid|0.0.1|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|
|ActiveFileInStatusBar|RoscoP|1.0.2|
|theme-setimonokai|SmukkeKim|0.0.1|
|language-pde|Tobiah|0.1.21|;


---


``` JavaScript
var test = {
	truc: 'bidule',
	methode() {
		return this.truc;
	}
}
```
in this example, "this" is not referenced as the current object ("test") but as "any" in IntelliSense

data.title: Don't pass `--debug-brk` if `inspector` debug protocol is selected in config
data.body:
- VS Code Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

For the debug configuration in `launch.json` below the following command is being executed:
`nodemon --inspect=31308 --debug-brk`

`--debug-brk` is redundant for that case. But for a case with `"protocol": "legacy"` it still should be there.

`launch.json`:
```json
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "nodemon",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "runtimeExecutable": "nodemon",
            "protocol": "inspector"
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: Fix uncaught exception while opening file that does not exist

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
**Bug**
Calling workspace.openTextDocument for a url that does not exist can trigger an uncaught exception. The root cause of this appears to be `destroyReferencedObject` calling `done` without an error handler.

**Fix**
Add a void error sink in this case

Fixes #27809

data.title: Make an option to launch debugging session before `preLaunchTask` is finished
data.body:
- VS Code Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

Right now a launched debug configuration with `preLaunchTask` waits till the task finishes before starting the debugging session. It's good, but in cases when `preLaunchTask` doesn't finish (e.g. watchers) the debugging will never start. So it is suggested to make a debug configuration option to launch the session asynchronously (in parallel) towards the task. Configuring `timeout` will also help in this case.

Maybe do it based on `"isBackground": true` property value of the task?

data.title: Make a convenient way to stop `preLaunchTask`

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VS Code Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

If there's a task from `.vscode/tasks.json` that doesn't finish (e.g. watcher), there's no convenient way to stop it. It's especially actual for a case when debug configuration is launched and it has such a `preLaunchTask` enabled.

Also, if I see a message in `OUTPUT` such as:
```
[Node]   App is running at http://localhost:3000 in development mode
[Node]   Press CTRL-C to stop
[Node] 
```
And pressing CTRL-C does nothing, it doesn't stop the task.

So It is suggested to make a convenient way to stop such a task. For instance, place some button in GUI to stop the task.

data.title: Stringify Telemetry Fields in the TS Extension
data.body:
**bug**
Non-string telemetry fields for the ts extension are not being processed properly. This effects some of the new fields added in TS 2.3.4

**Fix**
Stringify all the fields before uploading them

data.title: Cannot edit any file with Window Zoom level -4
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insiders dated 6/2/2017
- OS Version: Mac

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change Window zoom level to -4
2. Try editing any file => nothing happens
3. Change zoom level: still cant edit
4. Reload window after changing zoom level: you can edit now

Note: If you are connected to an external monitor, everything works as expected.

Everything works as expected in the stable bits of 1.12

data.title: Pass args in launch.json without wrapping them in quotation marks?
data.body:
- VS Code Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64
- Node.js Version: 7.10.0

How to pass `args` and `runtimeArgs` in `launch.json` **as is** without wrapping them in quotation marks (`""`)? The problem is some cli tools can't process quotation marks correctly and refuse to launch. `nodemon` - for instance:

```
C:\Dev\node-typescript-vscode>nodemon "--exec ts-node ./src/index.ts"
  Usage: nodemon [nodemon options] [script.js] [args]

  See "nodemon --help" for more.
```

`launch.json`:
```javascript
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch via global nodemon",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "runtimeExecutable": "nodemon",
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "--exec ts-node ./src/index.ts"                
            ],
            "protocol": "inspector",
            "restart": false,
            "console": "integratedTerminal",
            "internalConsoleOptions": "neverOpen",
            "args": [
                // "--exec ts-node ./src/index.ts"
            ]
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: [SCM] Allow provider to contribute to Rename and Delete file operations

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
With TFVC (and perhaps other distributed version control systems), special commands need to be run when files are deleted (`tf delete`) and renamed (`tf rename`).  If those commands aren't used, files either won't be pended for change or will be incorrectly pended (like a delete and add instead of rename).

Today, we need to provide our own context menus to ensure we perform the proper commands:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2796865/26795066/2ff16d1a-49f2-11e7-9263-40413741fd14.png)

However, if the TFVC user isn't aware of these options (or just forgets), they can perform version control operations they didn't intend.  It'd be great if the active SCM provider could be notified about the operation and take part (run its command, as needed).

(I thought I had opened this issue previously but can't seem to locate it.  Apologies if it's a dupe.)

data.title: Markdown Snippet Prefix Does Not Trigger Snippet
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|plsql|casian|0.0.3|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.1.1|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.10.0|;


---

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Add the following to the markdown.json file:
```javascript
    {
        "Start a New Day": {
            "prefix": "mdday",
            "body": [
                "## Date: 2017-$1",
                "### Tasks & Activities",
                "- Daily Planning (:30)",
                "- $2"
            ],
            "description": "Create template for new day's activities"
        }
    }
```
2. Create a markdown file named "test.md"
3. Verify that the Language Mode in the bottom right of the editor reads "Markdown"
3. Type "mdday"

**Expected behavior:**

Type-ahead functionality would show the portion of the prefix typed, and hitting TAB would enter the code contained in the body of the prefix.

**Actual behavior:**

Nothing happens as "mdday" is typed, and no code is inserted. The snippet CAN be triggered by the menu path View > Command Palette > Insert Snippet and scrolling to the bottom of the list where the Prefix and Description are listed.

**Additional Information:**

I have a user snippet file for both HTML and JS files as well, and those snippet files appear to be working as designed. The code snippet shown above is now the only one in my markdown.json file.

data.title: Expose the internal getLanguageIdAtPosition to extensions
data.body:
`document.getLanguageId()` only gives the language of the document.

In case of embedded languages like css/js in html, the editor is aware of the languageId at position via [getLanguageIdAtPosition](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/afe47dc84467b487ce0079ff72f55e7ef4f7ebca/src/vs/editor/common/editorCommon.ts#L851). But this information is not available for extensions.

In my case, the emmet extension needs to know whether it should suggest html or css abbreviations based on the language under the cursor. Of course, I can do that by using some regex magic, but since this information is available in the editor, it would be good to make it available for extensions as well.

data.title: Keyboard shortcuts (copy, paste...) unexpectedly rebound

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

Many macOS users found that the copy/paste keyboard shortcut becomes **not working randomly**, according to #24112 and #26344.

I also encountered this issue few moments ago and found something interesting:

**The keyboard shortcut of copy/paste still works but they have been rebound unexpectedly.**

Check the following screenshots, the copy/paste key were rebound to `control+option+command+c/v`, although it still shows `command+c/v` in the context menu of search area. With these weird shortcuts, I can successfully paste something to search area, without the need to reload the window or restart VS Code.

![](http://i.imgur.com/Mv4OnaU.png)

![](http://i.imgur.com/qKl26vY.png)

I still cannot figure out how to reproduce these changes of keybindings, but this fact may be helpful for further investigation.

data.title: Buttons for Tasks
data.body:
While there is an extension called vscode-status-bar-tasks, that adds status bar buttons to invoke tasks,

1. It has an issue with watch tasks (it does not cancel them when one closes vscode)
2. No one seems to be actively working on that project

It would be a very nice feature to have buttons for invoking tasks. Can you consider it for the backlog?
